author: LEGO_Ink
title: Parts to a Puzzle
review:
70372 Combo NEXO Powers

Part Count: 10

Wallet Request: $3.99

 

This new line of packs presents a neat opportunity, and challenge, to build your NEXO Powers. Each pack comes with:

  • a Base[?], although it's used as a shield in 70366-Battle Suit Lance
  • 2 Light Bluish Gray - Plate, Modified 1x2 w/ Clip Horizontal on Side
  • 1 2x2 Dark Blue Tile
  • 1 Trans-Orange Boat-Stud
  • 5 NEXO Power Shields

 

The front of the pack:

Indicated on the front, you receive 5 NEXO Powers, out of 35. One each of Red, White, Green, Blue, and Yellow. That means each color has 7 potential options. Since I only bought one pack, I can't say for certain that each pack would grant you all five different powers, vs. maybe a new Yellow and Blue but repeats on Red, White, and Green. There's also no touch distinguishing so, unlike Collectible Mini-Figs, there isn't a way to check what you're picking out.

[img]https://c5.staticflickr.com/1/675/31063118524_b68aa2923d_z.jpg[/img]

 

 

The Contents:

Everything. Straightforward. I really like the new Element. I forgot to copy the ID before making this post, but here are some details:

  • The top and bottom have room to place 3 NEXO Powers, but are studded for a 2x2 [or longer]
  • The center fits a standard Technic Pin
  • There are 3 spots to clip attachments, modified plates, claws, etc.

[img]https://c3.staticflickr.com/6/5597/31866004666_b2c8fb0a3d_z.jpg[/img]

 

 

The Paper:

Instructions, also straightforward. Once more packs are collected, an image indicates the user can make a large geometric shape. It has multiple flat spots to land on, but only 4 functional faces for Powers.

The back of the paper [unpictured] has a chart of potential Powers. 

[img]https://c7.staticflickr.com/1/516/31063116934_4abd387224_z.jpg[/img]

 

A Fun Side-Project:

I built this little guy after getting a second base/sheild in 70366 - Battle Suit Lance. I can't wait to see where others place it within MOCs. For this one I started simple, after coming across some column bricks. The result had a subtle reminder towards something that may be found in the ancestral worlds of Metroid Prime.

[img]https://c3.staticflickr.com/6/5597/31072540114_03b045e949_n.jpg[/img]

 

If you're looking for extra powers, without buying whole sets, this could be a way to go. At $3.99/ea., you're at a minimum of $28 to get all of them. If you just want to snag a few, it's also an option.

The building experience wasn't really there, but if you have more I guess you could keep changing things out.

While there's not a lot to boost these packs, I did give it a 4 overall. It's a neat concept, it's cheap, and there is more to do with it besides basing NEXO Powers.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Intriguing Idea, Executed Passably
review:
Set #70372 Combo NEXO Powers Wave 1: In the second year of NEXO Knights LEGO introduced a new blind bag packaged element, the Combo Nexo Powers. It’s a fairly straightforward little item, I’m not entirely certain how popular it is, but it does have interesting prints on the shield element at a cheap price.

Pros:

  • Five Powers in each Pack.

  • Various new prints on certain shield colours.

  • Buildable and connectable additional pieces to house three of the five shield elements.

  • Seven of each shield type, blue, white, green, red and yellow to collect.

  • New hexagonal shaped shield element great for MOC fans.

Cons:

  • 35 to collect and blind nature means duplicates are expected and anticipated.

  • Collect and trade shield elements may not be a viable catch for buyers.

  • Price-per-piece ratio a bit high considering lack of Minifigures.

  • Lack of proper storage for extra shields when Compo powers attached to hexagonal shaped large shield element.

Overall opinion

Personally I find these interesting enough to try and collect them all. But I will admit they are a bit lacking for the price, the printed elements consist mostly of powers we’ve seen before, but there are a few different powers and possible some new ones as well. I’m not sure I’d recommend this set; however I will admit it’s an interesting attempt at getting Shield Powers to kids who may not be able to get all the larger sets and just want the powers to play the App game.
